intro: Scorzonera dzhawakhetica, commonly known as the Armenian scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It features a robust, tuberous root system that is often harvested for its edible qualities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine layer of hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with five petals and are arranged in a loose raceme. Scorzonera dzhawakhetica thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
